subtitle:
A Swiss-style dish that is guaranteed to break the ice if entertaining.
Serve with cubed French bread and raw vegetables for dipping.

method.text: Melt butter in a fondue or heavy-based pan.
Saute onion and mushrooms for 10 min.
Add flour and mustard, mixing thoroughly. Remove from heat and gradually blend in the milk.
Return to heat and bring to boil, stirring continuously, to make a thick sauce. Add the cheese and stir until the cheese has melted. Do not allow to boil.
Stir in the walnuts, kirsch and cream. Season.
Serve in the pan, or in a warmed serving dish, surrounded with bread and vegetables for dipping.

title: Lancashire cheese, mushroom and walnut fondue
